identificationModule.briefTitle: Suhexiang Pill for Acute Ischemic Stroke: A Registry Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Suhexiang Pill for Acute Ischemic Stroke: A Prospective Registry Study of Real-world Data

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate the effectiveness and safety of the Suhexiang Pill for patients with acute ischemic stroke in real-world settings.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Suhexiang Pill, a traditional Chinese patent medicine, is widely used in China for acute stroke. However, there is a lack of evidence of its efficacy and safety for acute ischemic stroke in real-world setting. This registry study will recruit 1000 patients who receive Suhexiang Pill treatment after acute ischemic stroke.

interventions.name: Suhexiang Pill
interventions.description: Suhexiang Pill is an approved traditional Chinese patent medicine.

primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients independent is defined as the modified Rankin Scale score of 0, 1, or 2.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: The National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) ranges from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating more severe neurological deficits.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The change from baseline to day 10 or discharge.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) is used to describe the extent of impaired consciousness in all types of acute medical and trauma patients, ranging from 0 to 15, with lower scores indicating more severe impaired consciousness.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The change from baseline to day 10 or discharge.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The patient reported outcome (PRO) scale of stroke consists of four dimensions including the influence on physical, emotional, and social functioning, as well as the overall satisfaction with treatment.
